name: Treetops Banff Bed and Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Treetops for two nights during our round trip of Western Canada. We received a very warm welcome and were offered plenty of practical advise on what to do & see. Breakfast was by far the best we had during the whole trip! Beyond Banff being an obviously great location for exploring this part of the Rockies, Treetops is very conveniently located in easy walking distance from downtown Banff without having any the noise. The common guest room is beautifully decorated and has a great balcony. If you wanted to be a bit picky, you'd have to point out that the rooms are not very well soundproofed. Notwithstanding, thoroughly recommended!
reviews.title: Great hosts, excellent breakfast, covenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just loved staying at this B&B. The house was nice, up to date, clean. The owners made us feel right at home. The location is perfect for walking downtown. Our only issue was that the walls felt thin so therefore we felt we had to whisper. Our room was below the main gathering area and come early morning as they were preparing the breakfast for the guest the noise woke us up earlier than we wanted to be. We enjoyed it enough but next time we might check out another spot but only because we felt we had to be really quiet or we would disturb everyone else.
reviews.title: Great location, wonderful owners but it was a bit noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were somewhat disappointed with treetops. While the hosts were lovely and the accommodation was clean and relatively comfortable, the rooms are very shabby and somewhat overpriced. This B&B on their website comes across as being a lot more comfortable/luxurious than what is actually is. Given the quality of the accommodations, we felt this was overpriced.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived in Banff we found immediatly the B&B with a very good location close to the towncenter. After the check-in with Rosemary, she opened the room (a little flat in fact), down the stairs we discovered the flat (a cute living room with everything to prepare some breakfast and more), the king-size bed was very very comfortable and we found peace and quiet after the hikes of the days before. Ready to start on the next day.
reviews.title: Lovely place with lovely host

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rosemary was very helpfull to advise us for things to do in Banff and where to have lunch and breakfast.
reviews.title: A lovely B&B, spacious accommodation and very friendly hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: good location on the out skirt of the town but only a 2 minute walk into the centre of Banff, well looked after and our hosts very accommodating to our needs early leaving and late returns.
reviews.title: Lovely place to stay, very welcoming hosts, breakfast always a pleasure.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are currently on a 3 week visit to Canada/Alaska which we have organized ourselves. Part of the trip is touring around by car for 10 days. We prefer to stay in B&B's whilst touring because we enjoy meeting local people. We booked Treetops B&B because of good reviews on Tripadvisor. We arrived tired and hungry after an 8 hr drive from Kelowna and were disappointed with the shabby appearance of the house. Things got worse when we were shown our room.. We had booked the Evergreen Junior Suite. It contained a bed , 2 chairs and a small table. The decoration was plain drab woodchip wallpaper and 2 non-descript paintings. No TV, no comfortable chairs, no coffee making, No Wifi and no toiletries other than a half full bottle of hand soap. The small en-suite bathroom had a shower and a WC. The window had what looked like a piece of shower curtain hanging on it.
reviews.title: Probably the worst place we have ever stayed - awful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a residents lounge upstairs which had a TV and coffee making. One of the other bedrooms was directly off this room .When the residents of this room came in at 9.30pm and told us they were going to bed because they had an early start we felt we had to turn off the TV and go back to our dismal bedroom.
reviews.title: NICE AND WITH FRIENDLY HOST

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All this for $175 (£115) per night !!!
reviews.title: All of the comforts of home in the most beautiful setting in the world!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a night without sleep, we left before breakfast and found somewhere else to stay for our second night in Banff,
reviews.title: Very pleasant B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011
reviews.text: It seems that if you live in Banff and run a B&B it gives you a licence to charge what you want and think you can get away with it. This place certainly thinks it can. Well.....
reviews.title: Time for an update

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first and most obvious thing about this place is that the rooms needed to be updated badly. The walls are paper thin and you can hear everything. We one night unfortunately had to put up with a couple in a room above us going for it and they were oblivious to the fact they thought no one could hear. Wrong!!
reviews.title: Passing through Banff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were clean though and the bed comfortable just don't plan on sleeping in with the noise.
reviews.title: We really enjoyed our stay at the property and would recommend to couples.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was also clean and serviced daily along with our room. Our bathroom however did not have a power point. This is a simple necessity and a no brainer if you host people.
reviews.title: Relaxing time in Banff at Treetops

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The common area with tv is not ideal because a guest room is right next to it and it makes an awkward situation at night.
reviews.title: Great hosts, big rooms and convenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I endorse what previous reviewers have said, limited interaction with Rosemary & Peter, but that was fine, they were very accomodating. They are rather elderly, so I can understand that they may not wish to accomodate toddlers. Bed was comfortable, good cross ventlation. What really made it was the large sitting area upstairs, we arrived early, no problem with this and I was able to do my favourite pastime, a nap on a chesterfield in front of the TV. View was spectacular, location very much within walking distance of the downtown core. Could find no negatives.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: I am going to give a review about my first contact with them. Tried to stay with them but were refused without any reasons.
reviews.title: Refused to stay there without any explanation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I contacted Treetops Banff B&B via email, and informed them of the dates that we were going to stay there and also explained to them that we have a toddler. I ended up getting a reply that all it said was "Sorry, we're unable to accommodate you" No explanation of why. Are the dates that we requested not available or the fact that we have a toddler with us? I took the time to search them and read reviews and wrote a descriptive email, and in the end, they didn't take the time to even say Thank you for your interest in Treetops B&B...., you know to make us feel that they care. I work in customer service industry and would never dream of doing treating customers like, NEVER. I know it's Banff and it's busy season but it does not give you the excuse to treat customers like this. Never stayed there, disregard the "When did you travel date". Had to choose something in order to submit this review.
reviews.title: Great Location and Wonderful Hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Customers from BC
reviews.title: Next time I'll pay a little more!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Treetops for three nights - it was in a terrific location and easily accessible to the town (which was nice, as they had great parking and we could walk from the B&B to a lot of places). Peter and Rosemary were lovely, and the common area of the B&B was great to have a tea or coffee and relax. Our room was the only one without an ensuite, but the bathroom was close (right across the hall).
reviews.title: Superb!

description: Banff's exclusive bed and breakfast. Great central location - 2 mins walk to restaurants, shops and river. Spacious rooms with private bath. Private guest entrance, off-street parking. Private lounge with fireplace/TV, sunny balcony, mountain views, and healthy buffet breakfast.
